content.title: Post Matric Scholarship To Scheduled Caste Students Of Nagaland
content.department: Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India
content.details: The Directorate of Higher Education (DHE) has launched the Post Matric Scholarship to ST students of Nagaland scheme for providing socio-economic welfare to the students belonging to the residentship of Nagaland state. The student must be studying or getting admission to the post-matric class (class 11th, 12, UG, PG Degree). Post-matric Scholarship for ST Scholarship is awarded to the students of the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India. The objective of the ST scholarship is to provide financial assistance to these students to complete their studies at the college level.
benefits: To provide social security provisions to the students of post-matric classes.
Students will be able to pursue studies.
To provide financial assistance to these students to complete their studies at the college level.
Providing socio-economic welfare to the students belonging to the residentship of Nagaland state.
eligibility: The applicant must be pursuing post-matric (above class X) studies and belong to the Scheduled Tribe of Nagaland.
The Annual Income of the applicant‘s parents/guardians from all sources must not exceed ₹ 2.50 lakh (Rupees Two Lakh Fifty Thousand).
Applicant must be from Institution which has a valid AISHE/UDISE code.
Students who have failed their last examination (repeaters) are not eligible to apply.
Students who have availed of this scholarship at one stage of education and have passed but are studying in the same stage of education in a different stream/subject are not eligible.
Students having study breaks of more than 2 (two) years are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.
Applicant must not be a beneficiary of any other scholarship scheme.
Applicant must not be an employee of any government/semi government establishment.
Students pursuing Diploma/Certificate Course can also apply provided they fulfil the above criteria (1- 8) and their course duration is not less than two years.
Students studying in NIOS can also apply, provided they fulfil criteria 1 to 8 and have the specified subject combination.
content.application_process: Institutions are to inform/notify to the students about the scholarship and set a dateline for receiving their forms and documents. Institutions are to verify the form and documents and compile Annexure IV for eligible applicants. The Department will not entertain any request for inclusion in Annexure IV or submission of Annexure IV after the last date.
documents_required: Attested copy of class 10 Admit card.
Attested Mark Sheet(s) of the last class/year passed.
Attested Scheduled Tribe Certificate issued by the competent designated authority.
Attested Indigenous Certificate issued by the competent designated authority.
Part B Form (only for applicants studying outside Nagaland).
Part C Form (only for MPhil/PhD Fresh applicants).
Copy of the front page of Bank Passbook.
One recent passport photograph should be pasted on the printed form.
